fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • A headline was wrong to say that England’s housing stock had increased by 11%. About 190,000 new dwellings were added to the housing stock in the year to March 2016, which was an 11% increase on the previous year’s new additions, not in overall housing stock. The article named the Shell Centre as a London office block that had been converted to flats; it is still offices (Rush of office conversions lifts housing stock by 11%, 16 November, page 27). • A review of a Bugzy Malone gig last week gave the venue as the “Royal Albert Hall, Manchester”. The Manchester Albert Hall, a Grade II listed building which was previously a Wesleyan chapel, is yet to have royal status bestowed upon it (14 November, page 29).
